content: In Greek mythology, who was the god of wine, known as the liberator due to his power to free one from their normal self through madness, ecstasy or wine?

In Greek mythology, the god of wine, known for his ability to liberate individuals from their everyday selves through madness, ecstasy, or wine, is Dionysus. He is often associated with fertility, ritual madness, religious ecstasy, and theatre. Dionysus is one of the twelve Olympian deities and is the only one to have a mortal mother. His symbols include the grapevine, cup, tiger, panther, dolphin, ivy, and theater mask.
